name: WCKD RZR
slogan: The Intelligent Automated Data Privacy Solution
description:
Our key product Data Watchdog is the first intelligent automated tool to allow 
companies to manage data privacy, sharing and ethics. By incorporating a 
company’s data sharing rules, jurisdictional privacy rules, privacy frameworks, 
business rules and data and AI ethics frameworks together into one tool, the
Data Watchdog saves organisations thousands of hours and allows them to 
protect data down to the attribute/ field level.

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer/Engineering Manager/Technical Lead
jobs.description:
An exciting role in an early start-up. An experienced team are looking to build a brand-new product to take to market. Lots of interesting technical challenges and the opportunity to be involved in the growth of a team, a product and a company. Based in great space in central London but with the opportunity for flexible working.
WCKD RZR are looking to build their flagship product which needs to be built the right way. Designed, architected and then engineered; without any of the bureaucracy of an established organisation. Do it the way it should be done, not the way people tell you to do it. It's an interesting technical challenge and there are a lot of "moving parts"!

This is a critical hire for the team. You'll be leading the fledgling team and will be involved in the hiring/growth of the team, you'll be setting goals and designing a technical roadmap. You'll probably have had experience in a similarly fast-paced environment and will share our love of building robust, scalable systems with complete freedom but under tight timelines. We passionately believe in and Agile way of working, fast to fail and quick to change direction as the 
world around us changes.

You'll be working with modern Java technologies (though it's ok if you come from a different background) and JavaScript/React in a cloud environment and working with modern DevOps tools (Kubernetes/Docker). It's anticipated the role with be a 80/20 split in favour of hands-on technical work and so you'll still be very much at the "code face" but will also be involved in strategy/road-mapping and leading the team.

We work out of a pretty cool space in London city centre - easily accessible by train, bus or tube - and close to shops/bars.
If you're interested, please get in touch

jobs.title: Data Privacy Expert
jobs.description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Privacy Specialist to join our team at WCKD RZR in London.

Within this role you will be responsible for supporting and advising on all matters surrounding data protection/privacy.  You will be a subject matter expert in your field with specialist domain expertise in technology and  software. You will provide knowledge and guidance to multiple stakeholders.

We work in a collaborative environment in central London, share ideas and challenge the traditional. This is an opportunity to play a pivotal role in an early start-up.

Role Responsibility

Facilitating and supporting WCKD RZR  with the development of a data ethics frameworks. approach defining privacy policies for personal data processing, turning them into practical rules of the road solutions.  Partner with all key business areas to ensure data privacy issues are considered at the outset of new projects, products and initiatives.

To support the work of junior members of the privacy team across their areas of responsibility, including providing guidance

We’re happy to discuss flexible working.

Profile

Master’s Degree in IT, Law or anything in between that demonstrates your interest in the data protection and privacy domain ..

You have knowledge of and experience with relevant data protection and privacy laws and regulations (e.g. EU GDPR, and Privacy Shield) and industry standards and frameworks
You have the ability to efficiently understand client organisations and their business model and to tailor relevant processes to privacy requirements
You are able to communicate effectively with different stakeholders (e.g. business, legal, IT, security…) about data protection and privacy matters
You have an analytical mindset, strive for quality and are able to work in a result-oriented environment
Desirable

Technology, start up experience
